intro: [WRONG START] Pleurotholis inflata, commonly known as the inflated pleurothallis, is a species of orchid native to the cloud forests of Central and South America. It is characterized by its unique, swollen pseudobulbs and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The flowers are typically small, fragrant, and come in shades of white, yellow, and green, often with intricate patterns. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in the wild.
